definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: the massive foot stomps down where he just was.
sentences.chinese: 机甲硕大的脚重重地踏在他刚才的位置上。

sentences.english: Yes , just like we were about you .
sentences.chinese: 是啊，就像我们刚才担心你一样。

sentences.english: “The first was just a warning, ” Abrahim said.
sentences.chinese: “刚才第一次不过是警告，”亚伯拉罕说。

sentences.english: I ----- Tom ------- ------ Miss Li's office just now.
sentences.chinese: 我刚才看到汤姆走进了李老师的办公室。

sentences.english: He's just been setting up a bachelor party, he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说他刚才在布置一个单身汉派对的会场。

sentences.english: One moment they were playing games and now they quarreled.
sentences.chinese: 刚才他们还在做游戏，现在却吵起来了。

sentences.english: LX: As I said, during that entire time, my mind was blank.
sentences.chinese: 就像刚才我说的那样，那时我脑子一片空白。

sentences.english: If you offered me six times what you have just offered.
sentences.chinese: 即使你愿意给我六倍于你刚才出的钱数。
也许您还不太信服我刚才介绍的这些技术。

sentences.english: There was a bike under the tree just now.
sentences.chinese: 刚才树底下有辆自行车。

sentences.english: Han Jia, what did you sing just now?
sentences.chinese: 哎韩佳，刚才你唱的是什么歌？

sentences.english: He was here a moment ago. I wonder where he is now.
sentences.chinese: 他刚才还在这儿，现在不知道到哪儿去了。

sentences.english: But just minutes ago, Lawyer Li Li told me that the Supreme Court regulations are that verdicts can take as long as six months.
sentences.chinese: 但刚才李立律师告诉我，高院规定的期限是六个月。

sentences.english: The just said rise also doesn't feel, just discover a cool idea set of now person.
sentences.chinese: 刚才说的兴起还不觉得，现在才发现凉意袭人。

sentences.english: I took you fMr Green from the Customs just now. May I know your name?
sentences.chinese: 我刚才把你错当作海关的格林先生了。请问尊姓大名？

definition: Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
what's the matter?/what's going on?/how could that be?/how did that come about?/what's it all about?
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
